docs.snippet: Prime Minister Theresa May's government launches a challenge on Monday against a court ruling that it requires parliamentary approval to start the process of leaving the European Union, a decision that could upset Britain's Brexit plans....
docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Theresa May's government launches a challenge on Monday against a court ruling that it requires parliamentary approval to start the process of leaving the European Union, a decision that could upset Britain's Brexit plans.

headline.main: May's Brexit Plans Face British Supreme Court Test

docs.abstract: Bank of England holds its key interest rate steady, although cut could occur in August.

byline.contributor: Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin.

docs.snippet: Hedging of currency risks by small and medium-sized British companies surged before June's referendum on EU membership, but thousands were probably still exposed to the past fortnight's huge swings in the pound, a survey on Monday showed....

docs.snippet: Touching down in Scotland to visit his luxury resort and golf course, Mr. Trump took a victory lap of sorts after Britain voted to leave the European Union....
docs.lead_paragraph: Touching down in Scotland to visit his luxury resort and golf course, Mr. Trump took a victory lap of sorts after Britain voted to leave the European Union.
docs.abstract: Donald Trump, in Scotland to check in on his luxury Turnberry resort and golf course, calls Great Britain's vote to leave European Union 'a great thing'; draws connection between sentiments driving 'Brexit' vote and those fueling his own rise, and predicts vote will benefit his golf course.

headline.main: Donald Trump, in Scotland, Calls ‘Brexit’ Result ‘a Great Thing’
headline.print_headline: Trump, Visiting His Scottish Golf Courses, Praises the Result as Good for Business

docs.snippet: Britain’s vote to leave the Europe Union kicks off a fraught and unpredictable process likely to spook investors around the world....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain’s vote to leave the Europe Union kicks off a fraught and unpredictable process likely to spook investors around the world.
docs.abstract: Global financial markets experience severe turbulence after British vote to leave European Union; anxious investors flock to safest bets amid uncertainty of unprecedented move's effect on global economy; re-emergence of nationalist and populist politics in West produces skepticism about globalized economy.

headline.main: Turbulence and Uncertainty for the Market After ‘Brexit’
headline.print_headline: Turbulence, and a Lot of Uncertainty, for Investors as the Global Market Wobbles
